item.title: Remember the Boardwalk? A Vintage Look at Las Vegas' Coney Island Dream
item.description:
From Holiday Inn to Boardwalk Dreams: Early Days on the Strip

The Las Vegas Strip has always been about transformation and reinvention. Few properties illustrate this better than the Boardwalk Hotel & Casino. Its story began in 1966, not as a glittering casino-resort, but as a straightforward Holiday Inn. Designed by the talented Homer Rissman, it offered a practical, mid-Strip lodging option â€“ a far cry from the themed extravaganzas that would later define the area. For years, it operated as a quiet contributor to the burgeoning Las Vegas landscape, offering a restaurant, cocktail lounge, and meeting space for business travelers.
